_note: Compares AI DOGE tracked spending vs GOV.UK MHCLG Revenue Outturn by SeRCOP category

categories.notes: AI DOGE tracks 306% more than GOV.UK outturn — likely includes capital/grant pass-through or multi-year project spend not reflected in revenue outturn
Spending tracked is 100% below GOV.UK outturn — possible unmapped expenditure or different departmental boundaries

insights: AI DOGE data covers 116% of GOV.UK reported expenditure — excellent coverage
3 categories show significant variance (>25%): Planning and development services, Housing services (GFRA only), Environmental and regulatory services
3 categories are on track (within 10% of GOV.UK outturn): Central services, Cultural and related services, Highways and transport services
Dominant pattern is underspend (2 categories) — AI DOGE spending data captures a subset of total council expenditure reported to MHCLG
"Planning and development services" shows 306% overspend — AI DOGE department mappings may be broader than the GOV.UK SeRCOP classification
